newsitem.title: PERU: Peru says it refinanced $186 mln debt with Sweden.
newsitem.headline: Peru says it refinanced $186 mln debt with Sweden.

text.p: The Peruvian government on Thursday said it refinanced $186 million of debt with the Swedish government as part of a series of agreements it has been negotiating with 14 creditor nations of the Paris Club.
"The total amount reaches $186 million and corresponds to commercial debt with the official Swedish agency Swedish Export Credits Guarantee Board (EKN)," an Economy Ministry statement said.
The statement said the debt would be repaid between 1999 and 2015, and the agreeement "contemplates the possibility of carrying out debt conversion operations."
The Swedish government favored anti-poverty debt conversion projects, it added.
The debt agreement was signed in Lima by Economy Minister Jorge Camet and Swedish Ambassador Ulf Lewin.
